The Parāyanavagga: The Parāyanavagga’s Verses
“I will sing the Parāyana,
(so said the venerable Piṅgiya)
As I have seen, so I will speak;
Vimalo, of great wisdom,
Free from desire, liberated, a nāga;

analyzed: kissa hetu musā bhaṇe  pahīna mala mohassa
translated: For what reason would he speak a lie?🔽For one who has abandoned impurity and delusion,
Who has given up conceit and hypocrisy;
Now I will praise
Words that are well-spoken.
The Buddha, the dispeller of darkness, the all-seeing one,
Who has gone to the end of the world, overcome all existence;
Free from taints, having abandoned all suffering,
The one who speaks the truth, the brahmin, is worshipped by me.
Just as a bird would abandon a small pond
And go to a fruitful forest;
So I, having abandoned the small,
Have entered the great ocean, like a swan.

original: Mano hi me brāhmaṇa tena yutto.🔽Paṅke sayāno pariphandamāno,
analyzed: manaḥ hi me brāhmaṇa tena yuttaḥ  paṅke sa yānaḥ pariphandamānaḥ
translated: For my mind is connected with that, brahmin.🔽Lying in the mud, writhing,
I swam from island to island;
Then I saw the Fully Enlightened One,
Who had crossed over the flood, was without pollutants.”
“Just as Vakkali was freed in faith,
And Bhadrāvudha and Āḷavaka;
In the same way, you too should be freed in faith,
You will go beyond Death’s realm, Piṅgiya.”
“Even more I have confidence,
Having heard the Sage’s words.
The Fully Enlightened One has removed the covering,
He is without blemish, and has understanding.
Having directly known the overlord gods,
He knows all, the best of the best.
The Teacher, who has answered all questions,
For those who have doubts.
He is unperturbed, unshaken,
For whom there is no simile anywhere;
